meanings.definition: A stanza or section of a poem or song.
meanings.sent1: The poet recited beautiful verses at the event.
meanings.sent2: She wrote a heartfelt verse for her best friend's birthday card.
meanings.sent3: The verses in the song made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His verses painted a vivid picture of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to analyze the verses for homework.

meanings.sent1: The book contained a famous verse that everyone loved.
meanings.sent2: Each verse in the poem had a different rhyme scheme.
meanings.sent3: The verse on the page was written in elegant calligraphy.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite verse from the play was about love and loss.
meanings.sent5: The poet's verses flowed smoothly, capturing the reader's attention.

meanings.definition: To compete or play against in a game or sport.
meanings.sent1: The two teams will verses each other in the final match.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys verses his friends in friendly basketball games.
meanings.sent3: I will verses you in a chess match and see who wins.
meanings.sent4: She decided to verses the champion in a thrilling tennis match.
meanings.sent5: The siblings like to verses each other in video games for fun.
